title: Ships of Discovery
subtle:
Informational (nonfiction), 1,686 words, Level T (Grade 3), Lexile 910L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     W and Y		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     W and Y		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in level                     Y		                 
		Multilevel Book also available in level                     Y
description: Ships of Discovery is an informational book about the types of boats that explorers built and used when discovering new lands. Ships and conquests of Polynesian, Viking, European, and Chinese explorers are highlighted. The author also describes the people who set out to sea as well as their motivations for going. Illustrations and maps support the text.
highFrequencyWords: accustomed, caravels, catamaran, clipper ships, cultures, galleons, knarrs, knots, masts, scurvy, streamlined
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
comprehension: Adjectives                : Identify adjectives and the nouns they describe
awareness: Compound Words                : Identify and create compound words
phonics:
Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
